snippet: After machinists in the Seattle area voted no on a contract extension tied to a new jet, Boeing said it would consider other places for the project.
abstract: Boeing announces that it will consider new home to build its 777x airliner project after machinists in Washington State overwhelmingly reject contract extension tied to the new jet; company had promised to keep project, which was expected to add 10,000 jobs, in Washington if machinists approved eight-year contract that would have protected company from strikes through 2024.
lead_paragraph: After machinists in the Seattle area voted no on a contract extension tied to a new jet, Boeing said it would consider other places for the project.

headline.main: Union’s Rejection Puts Future Home of Boeing 777X in Doubt
headline.print_headline: Rejection Puts Future Home of Boeing Jet in Doubt

keywords.value: International Assn of Machinists and Aerospace Workers
keywords.name: organizations
